about.title: About Jawafdehi
about.subtitle: A civic tech initiative committed to transparency, accountability, and justice in Nepal.

aboutUs.title: About Us
aboutUs.description: Jawafdehi is an open-source civic‑tech platform for Nepal built by Nepali to document allegations of corruption. Grounded in a Gen‑Z mandate for transparency and action, Jawafdehi aims to become the Nepali accountability system to bring an end to the practice of unaccountability—holding corrupt politicians, individuals, and others accountable through independent, evidence‑first, and citizen‑powered means. Using AI to process government documents, track news sources, and generate comprehensive investigation reports, Jawafdehi scales the fight against corruption through technology.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description1: Jawafdehi is dedicated to promoting transparency and accountability in Nepal by documenting, verifying, and publishing corruption cases involving public entities. We empower Nepali citizens with verified information to drive systemic change and hold public officials accountable for their actions.
mission.description2: Through rigorous investigation, documentation, and public disclosure, we aim to create a more transparent governance system where corruption is exposed, justice is served, and public trust is restored.

information.title: Understanding Corruption & Our Process
information.subtitle: Learn how we verify information, what constitutes corruption, and how you can contribute to transparency.

whatIsCorruption.title: What is Corruption?
whatIsCorruption.description: Corruption is the abuse of entrusted power for private gain. In the context of public service, it represents a betrayal of the public trust and includes various forms of misconduct.

bribery.title: Bribery
bribery.description: Offering, giving, receiving, or soliciting something of value to influence the actions of an official.

embezzlement.title: Embezzlement
embezzlement.description: Theft or misappropriation of funds placed in one's trust or belonging to one's employer.

nepotism.title: Nepotism & Favoritism
nepotism.description: Favoritism granted to relatives or friends regardless of merit, especially in hiring or contract awards.

conflictOfInterest.title: Conflict of Interest
conflictOfInterest.description: Situations where personal interests improperly influence professional duties and decisions.

abuseOfResources.title: Abuse of Public Resources
abuseOfResources.description: Misuse of public funds, assets, or authority for personal benefit or unauthorized purposes.

verification.title: How We Verify Information
verification.description: We maintain rigorous standards for verification to ensure accuracy and reliability. Every case undergoes a multi-stage review process before publication.

sourceCollection.title: 1. Source Collection
sourceCollection.description: We gather information from government records, media reports, NGO investigations, public documents, and credible whistleblowers.

crossVerification.title: 2. Cross-Verification
crossVerification.description: Multiple independent sources are required. Claims must be corroborated through official documents, witness accounts, or verifiable evidence.

teamReview.title: 3. Team Review
teamReview.description: Our moderation team reviews each case for accuracy, legal compliance, and ethical standards before approval.

continuousUpdates.title: 4. Continuous Updates
continuousUpdates.description: Cases are monitored for developments. Updates, responses from accused entities, and investigation outcomes are added as they emerge.

standards.title: Verification Standards
standards.minSources: Minimum of two independent, credible sources for each allegation
standards.officialDocs: Official documentation or verifiable evidence whenever possible
standards.clearDistinction: Clear distinction between verified facts, allegations, and ongoing investigations
standards.rightToRespond: Right to respond granted to all accused entities
standards.protectSources: Protection of sources and sensitive information

howToReport.question: How can I report a corruption case?
howToReport.answer1: You can report a case through our "Report Allegation" form. Please provide as much detail and supporting documentation as possible. You can choose to submit anonymously or with your identity.
howToReport.answer2: All submissions are reviewed by our moderation team before being published. We may contact you for additional verification if needed.

afterSubmit.question: What happens after I submit a report?
afterSubmit.answer: Your submission enters our verification queue. Our team will review the information, verify through multiple sources, and determine if it meets our publication standards. This process typically takes 7-14 days depending on case complexity. You'll be notified of the outcome if you provided contact information.

anonymous.question: Is my identity protected if I report anonymously?
anonymous.answer: Yes. We take contributor privacy seriously. Anonymous submissions do not store any identifying information, and we have measures to protect all contributors from retaliation. Personal data like phone numbers and national ID numbers are never published.

entityResponse.question: Can accused entities respond to allegations?
entityResponse.answer: Absolutely. We believe in fair representation. Accused individuals and organizations can submit responses through our "Entity Response" portal. These responses are verified for authenticity and published alongside the allegations to provide complete context.

inaccurate.question: What if information on the platform is inaccurate?
inaccurate.answer: Despite our rigorous verification process, errors can occur. If you find inaccurate information, please contact us immediately through our feedback form with supporting evidence. We will review and correct any verified inaccuracies promptly. All corrections are documented in the case's audit trail.

funding.question: How is this platform funded?
funding.answer: Jawafdehi is funded through partnerships with civic organizations and potential grants from transparency-focused foundations. We maintain editorial independence and do not accept funding from government entities or organizations that could compromise our integrity.

useInfo.question: Can I use information from this platform?
useInfo.answer: Yes! All information on this platform is publicly accessible and can be freely used for research, journalism, advocacy, or educational purposes. We encourage proper attribution and responsible use of the data.
